ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to someone else. It gives you a great survey of Joyce's major hits while providing historical context and criticism. Class focuses mostly on close readings, which I found exteremely helpful, both in order to get a sense of Joyce's working method and to really look at the nuts and bolts of the text. In Joyce almost everything is in some way about language, so close reading works really well. And if you haven't had a chance to read Ulysses you better take this. For the love of god.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I'm really considering working on Joyce, or having a dissertation that in some way devotes a chapter to him, and that is mostly a result of this class. Yes, it was that good!
